title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 15 ยง 19.5 - Retention of operational costs by State
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 15 ยง 19.5 - Retention of operational costs by State

State Regulations
(a) All city tax monies collected in district
offices of the Department of Motor Vehicles located within New York City in any
calendar month less "recurring operational costs" for such transactions will be
distributed by the State Comptroller, upon certification from the Commissioner
of Motor Vehicles, to the commissioner of finance by the end of the next
succeeding month. (b) In addition
to the payments set forth in subdivision (a) of this section, the State

Comptroller, upon certification from the Commissioner of Motor Vehicles, shall, after setting aside and retaining the amounts described in section
19.4
(c) of this

Part, less monies withheld from monthly payments, distribute to the
commissioner of finance, on a quarterly basis, the balance of tax monies
collected, as follows: Quarter
ending

Distribution
by

December 31

April 25

March 31

June 25

June 30

September 25

September 30

December 25
(c) The Department of Motor Vehicles shall
deduct from its first quarterly payment to the city of New York, "implementation costs", incurred by the Department of Motor Vehicles. (d) The "recurring operational costs"
incurred by the Department of Motor Vehicles and its agents deducted from the
monthly and quarterly distributions to be made to the city of New York will be
determined on a transactional basis subject to change as costs change, and, as
certified from time to time by the Commissioner of Motor Vehicles. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 15
ยง
19.5

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
